pages.title: Come
pages.text: $(bold)Come$() is one of the first commands you should teach your Pet Rock™.$(br2)A rock that does not come when it is called will cause its owner endless embarrassment.$(br2)To teach your rock this command, place them on the ground and move a distance away.

Begin repeating the command $(bold)Come!$() or $(bold)Here Boy!$()$(br2)If your Pet Rock™ does not move, it is likely that they did not hear you the first time.$(br2)You may need to take a step forward and repeat the command. Amazingly, each time you step forward, your rock will move closer to you.$(br2)Once you are close enough, the rock will thrown themselves into your arms.
Should you be carrying too much, Pet Rocks™ are smart enough to realize that you would be unable to hold them and will remain seated on the ground.
